enWisdom: Fasting is one of the two means to good health
The purification of the body is [in] striving and fasting

Wisdom: صَوْمُ الْجَسَدِ الْإِمْسَاكُ عَنِ الْأَغْذِيَةِ بِإِرَادَةٍ وَاخْتِيَارٍ خَوْفاً مِنَ الْعِقَابِ وَرَغْبَةً فِي الثَّوَابِ وَالْأُجْرَةِ
enWisdom: Fasting of the body means restraining oneself from food willfully and by choice, out of fear of punishment and out of desire for reward and recompense

Wisdom: صِيَامُ الْأَيَّامِ الْبِيضِ مِنْ كُلِّ شَهْرٍ تَرْفَعُ الدَّرَجَاتِ وَتُعَظِّمُ [يُعَظِّمُ‏] الْمَثُوبَاتِ
enWisdom: Fasting on the ‘luminous days’ (ieon the th, th and th) of every [lunar] month raises the stations and magnifies the rewards

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ صَائِمٍ لَيْسَ لَهُ مِنْ صِيَامِهِ إِلَّا الظَّمَأُ
enWisdom: How many of those who are fasting gain nothing from their fast but thirst!

Wisdom: صَوْمُ النَّفْسِ إِمْسَاكُ الْحَوَاسِّ الْخَمْسِ عَنْ سَائِرِ الْمَآثِمِ وَخُلُوُّ الْقَلْبِ عَنْ جَمِيعِ أَسْبَابِ الشَّرِّ
enWisdom: Fasting of the soul means restraining the five senses from all the sins and emptying the heart of all the motives of evil

Wisdom: صَوْمُ الْقَلْبِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ صِيَامِ اللِّسَانِ وَصِيَامُ اللِّسَانِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ صِيَامِ الْبَطْنِ
enWisdom: Fasting of the heart is better than fasting of the tongue, and fasting of the tongue is better than fasting of the stomach

Wisdom: صَوْمُ النَّفْسِ عَنْ لَذَّاتِ الدُّنْيَا أَنْفَعُ الصِّيَامِ
enWisdom: Fasting of the soul from the pleasures of this world is the most beneficial fasting

Wisdom: صِيَامُ الْقَلْبِ عَنِ الْفِكْرِ فِي الْآثَامِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ صِيَامِ الْبَطْنِ عَنِ الطَّعَامِ
enWisdom: Fasting of the heart from thinking about sins is better than fasting of the stomach from food

Wisdom: زِيَارَةُ بَيْتِ اللَّهِ أَمْنٌ مِنْ عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ
enWisdom: Visiting the House of Allah is a safeguard against the torment of hellfire
